required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Telitacicept in Patients With Primary IgA Nephropathy
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Telitacicept in Patients With IgA Nephropathy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Telitacicept in patients with primary IgA nephropathy.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study consists of a 5-week screening period, a double-blind treatment period divided into phase A and phase B. Eligible subjects will be randomly assigned in a 1:1 ratio to receive either Telitacicept 240mg or placebo. Subjects will be given SC Telitacicept or placebo once a week for a total of 39 doses in phase A and once every 2 weeks for a total of 32 doses in phase B.
Primary endpoint of phase A will be measured at week 39. Primary endpoint of phase B will be measured at week 104.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in urine protein creatinine ratio (UPCR) (based on a 24-hour urine sample) at Week 39
Annualized estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) slope at Week 104

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in urine protein creatinine ratio (UPCR) (based on a 24-hour urine sample) at weeks 52, 78, and 104
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in UPCR at weeks 52, 78, and 104

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) at weeks 39, 52, 78 and 104
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in eGFR at weeks 39, 52, 78 and 104

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in urine albumin-to-creatinine ratio (UACR) (based on a 24-hour urine sample) at weeks 39, 52, 78 and 104
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in UACR (based on a 24-hour urine sample) at weeks 39, 52, 78 and 104

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects achieving urine protein creatinine ratio (UPCR) < 0.8 g/g (based on a 24-hour urine sample) at weeks 39, 52, 78 and 104
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects achieving UPCR < 0.8 g/g (based on a 24-hour urine sample) at weeks 39, 52, 78 and 104

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with a 30% decrease in estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) from baseline at Week 39
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients with a 30% decrease in eGFR from baseline at Week 39

secondary_outcome.measure: Annualized estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) slope at Week 52
Time to first occurrence of 30% decrease in estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR)
secondary_outcome.description: Time to first occurrence of 30% decrease in eGFR since the first dose of the study medicine

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects who received rescue therapy at weeks 52, 78, and 104
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects who received rescue therapy at weeks 52, 78, and 104

The composite endpoint event is defined as initiation of maintenance renal dialysis (for at least 1 month), renal transplant, renal failure (eGFR < 15 mL/min/1.73 m2 or greater than 30% decrease in eGFR from baseline), or death due to renal failure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence and severity of adverse events
secondary_outcome.description: An adverse event (AE) is any untoward medical occurrence in a patient or clinical investigation subject administered a pharmaceutical product and which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment.

other_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in 24-hour urine protein at Week 39
other_outcome.description: Change from baseline in 24-hour urine protein at Week 39

arm_group.description: Subjects will be given Telitacicept 240 mg SC once a week in phase A for a total of 39 doses and once every 2 weeks in phase B for a total of 32 doses.
Subjects will be given placebo SC once a week in phase A for a total of 39 doses and once every 2 weeks in phase B for a total of 32 doses.
